title: Judges Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Judges with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 21 chapters.

questions.question: Who was the first tribe that the LORD said should go up first against the Canaanites after the death of Joshua?
questions.explanation: The LORD said Judah should go up first against the Canaanites as recorded in Judges 1:2.

questions.question: What did the children of Judah do to Adonibezek after capturing him?
options: Cut off his thumbs and great toes
questions.correctAnswer: Cut off his thumbs and great toes
questions.explanation: They cut off his thumbs and great toes as a punishment, as described in Judges 1:6.

questions.question: Which city did the children of Judah take and set on fire?
questions.explanation: Judah took Jerusalem and set it on fire as recorded in Judges 1:8.

questions.question: Who was given Achsah, Caleb's daughter, as a wife after taking Kirjathsepher?
questions.explanation: Othniel, Caleb's younger brother's son, took Kirjathsepher and was given Achsah as wife (Judges 1:13).

questions.question: What did Achsah ask her father Caleb to give her after she came to him?
questions.explanation: She asked for springs of water in addition to the south land (Judges 1:15).

questions.question: Why were the children of Judah unable to drive out the inhabitants of the valley?
options: Because they had chariots of iron
questions.correctAnswer: Because they had chariots of iron
questions.explanation: The inhabitants of the valley had chariots of iron, making them difficult to drive out (Judges 1:19).

questions.question: Which tribe did not drive out the Jebusites who inhabited Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: The children of Benjamin did not drive out the Jebusites in Jerusalem (Judges 1:21).

questions.question: What was the original name of Bethel before it was called Bethel?
questions.explanation: Bethel was formerly called Luz (Judges 1:23).

questions.question: Which tribe was forced into the mountain by the Amorites?
questions.explanation: The Amorites forced the children of Dan into the mountain (Judges 1:34).

questions.question: How long were the children of Israel delivered into the hand of Midian because they did evil in the sight of the LORD?
questions.explanation: Israel was delivered into the hand of Midian for seven years due to their evil (Judges 6:1).

questions.question: Where did the angel of the LORD appear to Gideon?
questions.explanation: The angel of the LORD appeared to Gideon under an oak in Ophrah (Judges 6:11).

questions.question: What was Gideon doing when the angel of the LORD appeared to him?
questions.explanation: Gideon was threshing wheat by the winepress to hide it from the Midianites (Judges 6:11).

questions.question: What name did Gideon acquire after he destroyed the altar of Baal?
questions.explanation: He was called Jerubbaal, meaning 'Let Baal plead against him' (Judges 6:32).

questions.question: How did the angel of the LORD confirm to Gideon that he was truly a messenger from God?
options: Fire rose from a rock and consumed the offering
questions.correctAnswer: Fire rose from a rock and consumed the offering
questions.explanation: The angel touched the offering and fire consumed it from the rock (Judges 6:21).

questions.question: What was Gideon's response when he saw the angel of the LORD face to face?
questions.explanation: Gideon expressed fear saying, 'Alas, O Lord GOD!' after seeing the angel (Judges 6:22).

questions.question: What altar did Gideon build after the angel of the LORD departed?
questions.explanation: Gideon built an altar called Jehovahshalom, meaning 'The LORD is peace' (Judges 6:24).

questions.question: How many men did Gideon take with him to destroy the altar of Baal by night?
questions.explanation: Gideon took ten of his servants to destroy the altar at night (Judges 6:27).

questions.question: What sign did Gideon ask from God using a fleece to confirm his mission?
options: That the fleece would be wet with dew but the ground dry
That fire would consume the fleece
That the fleece would float on water
That the fleece would change color
questions.correctAnswer: That the fleece would be wet with dew but the ground dry
questions.explanation: Gideon asked that the fleece alone be wet with dew while the ground remained dry (Judges 6:37).

questions.question: How many men did God allow Gideon to keep for the battle against Midian?
questions.explanation: God reduced Gideon's army to 300 men to show His power (Judges 7:7).

questions.question: What tactic did Gideon use to confuse and defeat the Midianites?
questions.explanation: Gideon used trumpets and broken pitchers to cause confusion (Judges 7:16-20).

questions.question: What was the reaction of the Midianite commanders Oreb and Zeeb?
options: They were captured and killed by Gideon's men
questions.correctAnswer: They were captured and killed by Gideon's men
questions.explanation: Oreb and Zeeb were killed when Gideon's men slew them at the Jordan (Judges 7:25).

questions.question: Who was the judge that delivered Israel from the hand of the Moabites?
questions.explanation: Ehud delivered Israel from Moabite oppression (Judges 3:15).

questions.question: By what means did Ehud kill King Eglon of Moab?
questions.explanation: Ehud used a concealed sword to kill King Eglon (Judges 3:16-21).

questions.question: Who was the Deborah's military commander who led Israel to victory over Jabin king of Canaan?
questions.explanation: Barak led the army under Deborah's leadership (Judges 4:6-8).

questions.question: Who killed Sisera, the captain of Jabin's army?
questions.explanation: Jael killed Sisera by driving a tent peg through his head (Judges 4:21).

questions.question: Samson was a judge known for his great strength. What was the secret of his strength?
questions.explanation: Samson's strength was linked to his Nazarite vow, especially his uncut hair (Judges 16:17).

questions.question: Who betrayed Samson leading to his capture by the Philistines?
questions.explanation: Delilah revealed the secret of Samson's strength to the Philistines (Judges 16:18-19).

questions.question: How did Samson die?
options: By pulling down the temple pillars
questions.correctAnswer: By pulling down the temple pillars
questions.explanation: Samson pulled down the Philistine temple, killing himself and many Philistines (Judges 16:30).

questions.question: What vow was Samson under from birth?
questions.explanation: Samson was consecrated as a Nazarite from birth (Judges 13:5).

questions.question: Who was the judge that vowed to sacrifice the first thing that came out of his house if victorious against the Ammonites?
questions.explanation: Jephthah made a vow to offer as a burnt offering the first that came out of his house (Judges 11:30-31).

questions.question: What was the consequence of Jephthah's vow when he returned victorious?
options: His daughter came out first and was sacrificed
questions.correctAnswer: His daughter came out first and was sacrificed
questions.explanation: Jephthah's daughter was the first to come out, fulfilling his vow (Judges 11:34-39).

questions.question: Which judge was known for killing 600 Philistines with an ox goad?
questions.explanation: Shamgar slew 600 Philistines with an ox goad (Judges 3:31).

questions.question: True or False: The book of Judges repeatedly states that the Israelites did evil in the sight of the LORD.
questions.explanation: Throughout Judges, Israel’s repeated evil and the LORD’s response is a central theme.

questions.question: True or False: Deborah was both a prophetess and a judge of Israel.
questions.explanation: Deborah was a prophetess and judge, providing leadership and guidance (Judges 4:4).

questions.question: True or False: The children of Israel drove out all the inhabitants of the land completely during the time of Judges.
questions.explanation: Israel did not fully drive out all Canaanites; many remained and dwelt among them (Judges 1:27-33).

questions.question: True or False: Gideon was afraid to confront his father's household when destroying the altar of Baal.
questions.explanation: Gideon feared his father's household, so he destroyed the altar by night (Judges 6:27).

questions.question: True or False: Samson’s strength was lost immediately after he was captured by the Philistines.
questions.explanation: Samson regained strength when his hair began to grow back while in captivity (Judges 16:22-28).

questions.question: True or False: The angel of the LORD told Gideon that he was the mightiest man in Israel.
questions.explanation: The angel called Gideon 'mighty man of valour' but Gideon himself questioned this (Judges 6:12).

questions.question: True or False: Samson killed a lion with his bare hands.
questions.explanation: Samson killed a lion with his bare hands as a demonstration of his strength (Judges 14:5-6).

questions.question: True or False: Jephthah was rejected by his family before becoming a judge.
questions.explanation: Jephthah was a son of a harlot and was cast out by his family (Judges 11:1-2).

questions.question: True or False: The Spirit of the LORD came upon Gideon before the battle against Midian.
questions.explanation: The Spirit of the LORD came upon Gideon before the battle (Judges 6:34).

questions.question: True or False: The men of the city wanted to kill Gideon for destroying the altar of Baal.
questions.explanation: The men of the city wanted to put Gideon to death (Judges 6:30).

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the LORD, and the LORD delivered them into the hand of _____ seven years.'
questions.explanation: Israel was delivered into the hand of Midian for seven years due to their evil (Judges 6:1).

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'The LORD is with thee, thou _____ man of valour.'
questions.explanation: The angel of the LORD greeted Gideon as 'thou mighty man of valour' (Judges 6:12).

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'If thou wilt save Israel by mine hand, as thou hast said, Behold, I will put a _____ of wool in the floor.'
questions.explanation: Gideon asked for a sign using a fleece of wool (Judges 6:37).
